http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Dance Appreciation is a one-semester course designed to teach students the basic elements, principles, processes, and inherent qualities of dance. Students will examine a broad range of methods and will conduct critical analyses of the creative processes involved in dance. Students will reflect on the connections between society and dance. Dance Appreciation students will develop perceptual awareness and aesthetic sensitivity, as well as a foundation for a lifelong relationship with dance.The Standards for Accreditation require schools to offer one-half unit of survey of fine arts OR one-half unit of advanced art or advanced music. Dance Appreciation may be used to fulfill this requirement. Dance Appreciation will also satisfy the one-half credit fine arts requirement for graduation. Arkansas Department of Education approval is not required for Dance Appreciation.
Responding
Students will perceive and analyze artistic work.
Differentiate between various genres of dance for the stage
Identify the elements required to produce a dance performance
Demonstrate appropriate audience etiquette for live performances
Students will interpret intent and meaning in artistic work.
Describe the manner in which artistic expression is achieved through the elements of dance
Analyze the context of selected dance works from a variety of genres
Students will apply criteria to evaluate artistic work.
Discuss a dance work using established artistic criteria
Prepare a written critique of a live or recorded dance performance according to a given set of criteria
Connecting
Students will synthesize and relate knowledge and personal experiences to make art.
Explain the impact of personal experience, interests, and knowledge from multiple sources on a choreographer's or dancer's work
Identify uses of technology and/or production elements in dance
Use available technologies to discover dance resources
Students will relate artistic ideas and works with societal, cultural, and historical context to deepen understanding.
Identify the purposes of dance in different cultures
Explain the use of the elements of dance in various genres, styles, and culture
Identify the relationship between social change and dance
Examine the sequential development of dance through history

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: e.g., development of different genres, dances of the decades

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Relate dances to the historical time periods from which they originate
Discuss the impact of the relationship between dance and media

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: e.g., commercials, film, television, social media
